blocks.textContent:
## Introduction
Welcome! If you navigate to the [editor](../edit) (after logging in with Google) you can create pages like this one by using a mixture of markdown and extra components.

## Colors
For any `color` properties, here are your options:
| Color | Description |
| `primary`{color='primary'} | Main brand color, used as the default color for components. |
| `secondary`{color='secondary'} | Secondary color to complement the primary color. |
| `success`{color='success'} | Used for success states. |
| `warning`{color='warning'} | Used for warning states. |
| `info`{color='info'} | Used for informational states. |
| `neutral`{color='neutral'} | Neutral color for backgrounds, text, etc. |

## Markdown components
### `h1`
::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```mdc
# This is an h1
```

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

# This is an h1

::

::
### `h2`
::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```mdc
# This is an h2
```

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

# This is an h2

::

::
### `h3`
::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```mdc
# This is an h3
```

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

# This is an h3

::

::

### `a` (link)
::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```mdc
[Nuxt documentation](https://nuxt.com)
```

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

[Nuxt documentation](https://nuxt.com)

::

::

### `blockquote`

::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```mdc
> While Nuxt UI is free and open source, Nuxt UI Pro is a premium product that helps sustain Nuxt OSS development, check out the License section to learn more.
```

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

> While Nuxt UI is free and open source, Nuxt UI Pro is a premium product that helps sustain Nuxt OSS development, check out the License section to learn more.


::

::
### `strong`
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
**Strong text**
```
::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
**Strong text**
::
::
### `em`
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
*Emphasized text*
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
*Emphasized text*
::
::
### `s` (strikethrough)
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
~~The world is flat~~ We now know that the world is round.
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
~~The world is flat~~ We now know that the world is round.
::
::
### `mark` (highlighted)
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
I need to highlight these ==very important words==.
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
I need to highlight these ==very important words==.
::
::
### `sup` (superscript)
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
x^2^ is a square
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
x^2^ is a square
::
::
### `sub` (subscript)
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
H~2~O
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
H~2~O
::
::

### `ul` (unordered list)
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
- I'm a list item.
  - I'm nested.
- I'm the last list item.
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
- I'm a list item.
  - I'm nested.
- I'm the last list item.
::
::

### `ol` (ordered list)
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
1. I'm a list item.
  1. I'm another list item.
2. I'm the last list item.
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
1. I'm a list item.
  1. I'm nested.
2. I'm the last list item.
::
::

### `hr` (horizontal rule)
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
-------
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
-------
::

### `table`
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```mdc
| Prop    | Default   | Type                |
|---------|-----------|---------------------|
| `name`  |           | `string`{lang="ts"} |
| `size`  | `md`      | `string`{lang="ts"} |
| `color` | `neutral` | `string`{lang="ts"} |
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
| Prop    | Default   | Type                |
|---------|-----------|---------------------|
| `name`  |           | `string`{lang="ts"} |
| `size`  | `md`      | `string`{lang="ts"} |

### `img`
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

### `code`

Inline code

::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```mdc
`inline code`
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
`inline code`
::
::

You can use any of the [colors](#3-h2)

::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
`inline code`{color="error"}
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
`inline code`{color="error"}
::
::
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
`const isFalse = (b: boolean) => !b`{lang="typescript"}
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
`const isFalse = (b: boolean) => !b`{lang="typescript"}
::
::

| Prop    | Default   | Type |
| `lang`  |           | `string`{lang='typescript'} |
| `color` | `neutral` | `"error" | "primary" | "secondary" | "success" | "info" | "warning" | "neutral"`{lang='typescript'} |

### `pre` (code block)
::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

````mdc
```typescript
const isFalse = (b: boolean) => {
  return !b
}
```
````
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
```typescript
const isFalse = (b: boolean) => {
  return !b
}
```
::
::
Or name the code block like this:
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
````mdc
```typescript [is-false.ts]
const isFalse = (b: boolean) => {
  return !b
}
```
````
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
```typescript [is-false.ts]
const isFalse = (b: boolean) => {
  return !b
}
```
::
::

### Inline math

::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```latex
Energy $e$ and mass $m$ are related in the following way: $e = mc^2$
```

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
Energy $e$ and mass $m$ are related in the following way: $e = mc^2$
::

::


### Math blocks

::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```latex
$$y = \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} (1 + r/12)^{12n} - \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} r_0^i - r_0^n$$
```

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

$$y = \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} (1 + r/12)^{12n} - \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} r_0^i - r_0^n$$
::
::


## Components

### Youtube
Just add a link to a youtube video and it will render as a playable video on the page
::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```mdc
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dCxSsr5xuL8&t=11s
```

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dCxSsr5xuL8&t=11s

::

::

### Accordion
::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```mdc
::accordion

::accordion-item{label='First Item' icon='question-mark-circle'}
Add **markdown** content here
::

::accordion-item{label="Second Item" icon="light-bulb"}
==Second== item's content
::

::
```

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

::accordion
::accordion-item{label='First Item' icon='question-mark-circle'}
Add **markdown** content here
::
::accordion-item{label="Second Item" icon="light-bulb"}
==Second== item's content
::
::

::

::
| Prop   | Default      | Type                    |
| `type` | `'multiple'` | `'multiple' | 'single'`{lang='typescript'} |
### Badge
::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```mdc
::badge{color='secondary'}
Label **here**
::
```

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

::badge{color='secondary'}
Label **here**
::

::

::
| Prop    | Default     | Type                    |
| `color` | `'primary'` | `"neutral" | "error" | "warning" | "info" | "success" | "primary" | "secondary"`{lang='typescript'} |

### Callout
::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```mdc
::callout
Lorem velit voluptate ex reprehenderit ullamco et culpa.
::
```

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

::callout
Lorem velit voluptate ex reprehenderit ullamco et culpa.
::
::
::

| Prop    | Default     | Type     |
| `color` | `'primary'` | `"neutral" | "error" | "warning" | "info" | "success" | "primary" | "secondary"`{lang='typescript'} |
| `icon`  |             | `string` |
| `link`  |             | `string` | 

You can also use the `note`, `tip`, `warning` and `caution` shortcuts with pre-defined icons and colors:
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
::note
Here's some additional information.
::

::tip
Here's a helpful suggestion.
::

::warning
Be careful with this action as it might have unexpected results.
::

::caution
This action cannot be undone.
::
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
::note
Here's some additional information.
::
::tip
Here's a helpful suggestion.
::
::warning
Be careful with this action as it might have unexpected results.
::
::caution
This action cannot be undone.
::
::
::

### Card
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
::card{title="Icons" icon="users" color="secondary" link="https://heroicons.com"}
Click here to see __icons__.
::
```

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

::card{title="Icons" icon="users" color="secondary" link="https://heroicons.com"}
Click here to see __icons__.
::

::

::

### Card Group
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
::card-group

::card{title='Dashboard' icon='chart-bar' link'https://github.com/nuxt-ui-pro/dashboard'}
A dashboard with multi-column layout.
::

::card{title='SaaS' icon='credit-card' link='https://github.com/nuxt-ui-pro/saas'}
A template with landing, pricing, docs and blog.
::

::card{title='Docs' icon='document' link='https://github.com/nuxt-ui-pro/docs'}
A documentation with `@nuxt/content`.
::

::card{title='Landing' icon='presentation-chart-line' link='https://github.com/nuxt-ui-pro/landing'}
A landing page you can use as starting point.
::

::
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
::card-group

::card{title='Dashboard' icon='chart-bar' link'https://github.com/nuxt-ui-pro/dashboard'}
A dashboard with multi-column layout.
::
::card{title='SaaS' icon='credit-card' link='https://github.com/nuxt-ui-pro/saas'}
A template with landing, pricing, docs and blog.
::
::card{title='Docs' icon='document' link='https://github.com/nuxt-ui-pro/docs'}
A documentation with `@nuxt/content`.
::
::card{title='Landing' icon='presentation-chart-line' link='https://github.com/nuxt-ui-pro/landing'}
A landing page you can use as starting point.
::

::
::

::

### Code Collapse
::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

````mdc
::code-collapse

```css [main.css]
@import "tailwindcss";
@import "@nuxt/ui";

@theme static {
  --font-sans: 'Public Sans', sans-serif;

  --breakpoint-3xl: 1920px;

  --color-green-50: #EFFDF5;
  --color-green-100: #D9FBE8;
  --color-green-200: #B3F5D1;
  --color-green-300: #75EDAE;
  --color-green-400: #00DC82;
  --color-green-500: #00C16A;
  --color-green-600: #00A155;
  --color-green-700: #007F45;
  --color-green-800: #016538;
  --color-green-900: #0A5331;
  --color-green-950: #052E16;
}
```

::
````
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
::code-collapse{open=true}
```css [main.css]
@import "tailwindcss";
@import "@nuxt/ui";

@theme static {
  --font-sans: 'Public Sans', sans-serif;

  --breakpoint-3xl: 1920px;

  --color-green-50: #EFFDF5;
  --color-green-100: #D9FBE8;
  --color-green-200: #B3F5D1;
  --color-green-300: #75EDAE;
  --color-green-400: #00DC82;
  --color-green-500: #00C16A;
  --color-green-600: #00A155;
  --color-green-700: #007F45;
  --color-green-800: #016538;
  --color-green-900: #0A5331;
  --color-green-950: #052E16;
}
```
::
::
::
| Prop        | Default                             | Type                                                    |
| `icon`      | `'chevron-down'`{lang='typescript'} | `string` The icon displayed to toggle the code.         |
| `name`      |                                     | `string` The name displayed in the trigger label.       |
| `openText`  | `'Expand'`{lang='typescript'}       | `string` The text displayed when the code is collapsed. |
| `closeText` | `'Collapse'`{lang='typescript'}     | `string` The text displayed when the code is expanded.  |
| `open`      | `false`{lang='typescript'}          | `boolean`                                               |

### Code Group
Wrap your code-blocks around a `code-group` component to group them together in tabs.
::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

````mdc
::code-group

```bash [pnpm]
pnpm add @nuxt/ui
```

```bash [yarn]
yarn add @nuxt/ui
```

```bash [npm]
npm install @nuxt/ui
```

```bash [bun]
bun add @nuxt/ui
```

::
````

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

::code-group

```bash [pnpm]
pnpm add @nuxt/ui
```

```bash [yarn]
yarn add @nuxt/ui
```

```bash [npm]
npm install @nuxt/ui
```

```bash [bun]
bun add @nuxt/ui
```

::

::

::
| Prop | Default | Type |
| `'defaultValue'` | 0 | `number | string`{lang='typescript'} |

### Code Tree
::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

::code-collapse
`````mdc
::code-tree{defaultValue="app/app.config.ts"}

```ts [nuxt.config.ts]
export default defineNuxtConfig({
  modules: ['@nuxt/ui-pro'],

  future: {
    compatibilityVersion: 4
  },

  css: ['~/assets/css/main.css']
})

```

```css [app/assets/css/main.css]
@import "tailwindcss";
@import "@nuxt/ui-pro";
```

```ts [app/app.config.ts]
export default defineAppConfig({
  ui: {
    colors: {
      primary: 'sky',
      colors: 'slate'
    }
  }
})
```

```vue [app/app.vue]
<template>
  <UApp>
    <NuxtPage />
  </UApp>
</template>
```

```json [package.json]
{
  "name": "nuxt-app",
  "private": true,
  "type": "module",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "nuxt build",
    "dev": "nuxt dev",
    "generate": "nuxt generate",
    "preview": "nuxt preview",
    "postinstall": "nuxt prepare",
    "typecheck": "nuxt typecheck"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@iconify-json/lucide": "^1.2.18",
    "@nuxt/ui-pro": "^3.0.0",
    "nuxt": "^3.16.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "typescript": "^5.8.2",
    "vue-tsc": "^2.2.10"
  }
}
```

```json [tsconfig.json]
{
  "extends": "./.nuxt/tsconfig.json"
}
```

````md [README.md]
# Nuxt 3 Minimal Starter

Look at the [Nuxt 3 documentation](https://nuxt.com/docs/getting-started/introduction) to learn more.

## Setup

Make sure to install the dependencies:

```bash
# npm
npm install

# pnpm
pnpm install

# yarn
yarn install

# bun
bun install
```

## Development Server

Start the development server on `http://localhost:3000`:

```bash
# npm
npm run dev

# pnpm
pnpm run dev

# yarn
yarn dev

# bun
bun run dev
```

## Production

Build the application for production:

```bash
# npm
npm run build

# pnpm
pnpm run build

# yarn
yarn build

# bun
bun run build
```

Locally preview production build:

```bash
# npm
npm run preview

# pnpm
pnpm run preview

# yarn
yarn preview

# bun
bun run preview
```

Check out the [deployment documentation](https://nuxt.com/docs/getting-started/deployment) for more information.
````

::

`````
::

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

::code-tree{defaultValue="app/app.config.ts"}

```ts [nuxt.config.ts]
export default defineNuxtConfig({
  modules: ['@nuxt/ui-pro'],

  future: {
    compatibilityVersion: 4
  },

  css: ['~/assets/css/main.css']
})

```

```css [app/assets/css/main.css]
@import "tailwindcss";
@import "@nuxt/ui-pro";
```

```ts [app/app.config.ts]
export default defineAppConfig({
  ui: {
    colors: {
      primary: 'sky',
      colors: 'slate'
    }
  }
})
```

```vue [app/app.vue]
<template>
  <UApp>
    <NuxtPage />
  </UApp>
</template>
```

```json [package.json]
{
  "name": "nuxt-app",
  "private": true,
  "type": "module",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "nuxt build",

    "typecheck": "nuxt typecheck"
  },

    "@iconify-json/lucide": "^1.2.18",
    "@nuxt/ui-pro": "^3.0.0",
    "nuxt": "^3.16.0"
  },

    "typescript": "^5.8.2",
    "vue-tsc": "^2.2.10"
  }
}
```

```json [tsconfig.json]
}
```

````md [README.md]
# Nuxt 3 Minimal Starter

Look at the [Nuxt 3 documentation](https://nuxt.com/docs/getting-started/introduction) to learn more.

## Setup

Make sure to install the dependencies:

```bash
# npm
npm install

# pnpm
pnpm install

# yarn
yarn install

# bun
bun install
```

## Development Server

Start the development server on `http://localhost:3000`:

```bash
# npm
npm run dev

# pnpm
pnpm run dev

# yarn
yarn dev

# bun
bun run dev
```

## Production

Build the application for production:

```bash
# npm
npm run build

# pnpm
pnpm run build

# yarn
yarn build

# bun
bun run build
```

Locally preview production build:

```bash
# npm
npm run preview

# pnpm
pnpm run preview

# yarn
yarn preview

# bun
bun run preview
```

Check out the [deployment documentation](https://nuxt.com/docs/getting-started/deployment) for more information.
````

::


::

::
| Props          | Default                    | Type                                         |
| `defaultValue` |                            | `string` The default tab to select.          |
| `expandAll`    | `false`{lang="typescript"} | `boolean` Expand all directories by default. |

### Collapsible

Wrap your content with the `collapsible` component to display a [Collapse](https://ui.nuxt.com/components/collapsible) in your content.

::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

```mdc
::collapsible

| Prop    | Default   | Type                     |
|---------|-----------|--------------------------|
| `name`  |           | `string`{lang="ts"}      |
| `size`  | `md`      | `string`{lang="ts"}      |
| `color` | `neutral` | `string`{lang="ts"}      |

::
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
::collapsible
| Prop    | Default   | Type                     |
|---------|-----------|--------------------------|
| `name`  |           | `string`{lang="ts"} |
| `size`  | `md`      | `string`{lang="ts"} |
| `color` | `neutral` | `string`{lang="ts"} |
::
::
::
| Props       | Default                      | Type                                                           |
| `icon`      | `'chevron-down'`{lang="ts"}  | `string` The **icon** displayed to toggle the show/hide button |
| `name`      |                              | `string` The name displayed in the trigger **label**           |
| `openText`  | `'Show'`{lang="ts"}          | `string` The text displayed when the content is collapsed      |
| `closeText` | `'Hide'`{lang="ts"}          | `string` The text disolayed when the content is expanded       |

### Field
A field, prop or parameter to display in your content.
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
::field{name="name" type="string" required}
The `description` can be set here with full **markdown** support.
::
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
::field{name="name" type="string" required}
The `description` can be set here with full **markdown** support.
::
::
::

| Prop       | Default            | Type      |
| `name`     |                    | `string`  |
| `type`     |                    | `string`  |
| `required` | `false`{lang="ts"} | `boolean` |

### Field Group
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
::code-collapse
```mdc
::field-group
  ::field{name="analytics" type="boolean"}
    Default to `false` - Enables analytics for your project (coming soon).
  ::

  ::field{name="blob" type="boolean"}
    Default to `false` - Enables blob storage to store static assets, such as images, videos and more.
  ::

  ::field{name="cache" type="boolean"}
    Default to `false` - Enables cache storage to cache your server route responses or functions using Nitro's `cachedEventHandler` and `cachedFunction`
  ::

  ::field{name="database" type="boolean"}
    Default to `false` - Enables SQL database to store your application's data.
  ::
::
```
::
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
::field-group
  ::field{name="analytics" type="boolean"}
    Default to `false` - Enables analytics for your project (coming soon).
  ::
  ::field{name="blob" type="boolean"}
    Default to `false` - Enables blob storage to store static assets, such as images, videos and more.
  ::
  ::field{name="cache" type="boolean"}
    Default to `false` - Enables cache storage to cache your server route responses or functions using Nitro's `cachedEventHandler` and `cachedFunction`
  ::
  ::field{name="database" type="boolean"}
    Default to `false` - Enables SQL database to store your application's data.
  ::
::
::
::

### Icon
Find icon names from [heroicons](https://heroicons.com/) or just type `/` and search for the icon you are looking for.
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

| Prop   | Default | Type     |
| `name` |         | `string` |

### Key Binding
Search for special keys by typing `/` such as :kbd{value="meta"} and :kbd{value="shift"}
::tabs
::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}
```mdc
Search by pressing :kbd{value="meta"} :kbd{value="K"}
```
::
::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}
Search by pressing :kbd{value="meta"} :kbd{value="K"}
::
::
| Prop    | Default | Type     |
| `value` |         | `string` |

### Tabs

Use the `tabs` and `tabs-item` components to display tabs in your content.
::tabs

### Steps
Wrap your headings with the Steps component to display a list of steps.

Use the `level` prop to define which heading will be used for the steps.
::tabs

::tabs-item{label="Code" icon="code-bracket"}

````mdc
::steps{level="3"}

### Add the Nuxt UI Pro module in your `nuxt.config.ts`

```ts [nuxt.config.ts]
export default defineNuxtConfig({
  modules: ['@nuxt/ui']
})
```

### Import Tailwind CSS and Nuxt UI Pro in your CSS

```css [assets/css/main.css]
@import "tailwindcss";
@import "@nuxt/ui";
```

::

````

::

::tabs-item{label="Preview" icon="eye"}

::steps{level="3"}

### Add the Nuxt UI Pro module in your `nuxt.config.ts`

```ts [nuxt.config.ts]
export default defineNuxtConfig({
  modules: ['@nuxt/ui']
})
```

### Import Tailwind CSS and Nuxt UI Pro in your CSS

```css [assets/css/main.css]
@import "tailwindcss";
@import "@nuxt/ui";
```

::

::

::

| Prop | Default | Type |
| `level` | `'3'`{lang="ts"} | `"3" | "2" | "4"`{lang="ts"} |
